title: Tropico 3 - Steam Special Edition
notes: "Error creating process <msiexec /i vcredist.msi>. Reason: File not found" when attempting to install Microsoft Visual C++ 2005 Redist. Game does not run, instead a box with the text "Application load error 5:0000065434" appears

title: Tropico 3 - Steam Special Edition
notes: Fullscreen focus issues when trying to type in CD-key. Once you manage to load it, game seems to run fine. Runs OK with medium settings @720p, a bit slow with ultra settings.

title: Tropico 3 - Steam Special Edition
notes: Have CD code ready when starting game for first time, otherwise it will crash when you Alt-Tab. After that, it won't crash while Alt-Tabbing. Gets between 100-200 fps.

gpu: Intel Open Source Technology Center Mesa DRI Intel(R) Haswell Mobile x86/MMX/SSE2
notes: Installs and starts without problems. During play, the arrow keys don't work. So movement is only possible using the mouse. Some display settings (e.g. antialiasing) lead to crash.
title: Tropico 3

notes: I had no problems playing it. I'm just missing being able to move the camera with the keys but I don't remember if this game allows that or not.
title: Tropico 3

notes: Biggest issue by far, is that they keyboard not works. This breaks the tutorial (as you need alt-key to pan) and it makes the make very difficult to control.
title: Tropico 3

notes: Good overall performance. Depending on the camera view, frame rate fluctuates rapidly between 30-120 fps with ultra settings, but the game remains responsive at all times. Controlling the camera with Alt does not work.
title: Tropico 3
